Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: from left, part of black handle zone with vertical ivy leaf band; black-figure decoration consisting of chariot scene to right; from left, driver missing only top of head and legs; added red for hair and beard, white for belt and cross-straps; second occupant (head and legs missing) wears short red chiton and a corselet, and strikes with a spear); below, part of car with red details.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 40, pl. XX, no. 29)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 283, no. B249 bis)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0970)
